Schedule

You can find the class schedule below. The dates and plans are subject to change. I'll notify you of any modifications during class or via email.

Part 1: Principles of RWD (HTML)

Sept
01

Class 1: RWD Principles

We'll cover a brief history of web design, web standards and why responsive design is important.

Read For Class
There's nothing to read for today.

There's nothing due today.

Sept
08

Class 2: HTML Basics

We'll discuss the basics of HTML and code some live HTML in class. We'll also set up GitHub accounts and version control for future assignments.

Read For Class
  • HTML&CSS - Introduction, Ch. 1 Structure, Ch.2 Text, Ch. 18 Process & Design (out of order)
  • Absolute vs. Relative Paths and Links
  • Responsive Web Design - Ch. 1 Our Responsive Web
  • GitHub for Beginners
  • Getting Started With GitHub Pages

Sept
15

Class 3: Research and HTML Part 2

I'll introduce the semester project and we'll talk about developing research and goals for website projects. We'll also continue our HTML discussion with a hands-on lesson in class.

  • HTML&CSS - Ch. 3 Lists, Ch.4 Links
  • Focusing On Top Tasks

Part 2: Content Strategy and Mobile-First

Sept
22

Class 4: Content-First Design and HTML Part 3

We'll talk about how to prioritize content through content outlines and sketching. We'll practice with a hands-on content prioritization exercise. Finally, we'll finish our HTML lesson.

Read For Class
  • HTML&CSS - Ch. 5 Images, Ch.6 Tables, Ch.7 Forms, Ch.8 Extra Markup
  • Content-First Design by Steph Hay
  • Content and Style Prototyping by Jeremy Lloyd
  • Structure First. Content Always. by Mark Boulton
  • In Class - We'll Watch the Mobile Content Mandate (Video) by Karen McGrane - 14:30 start, slide 20)
Due Today
Research/Competitive Analysis
Assigned Today
HTML Basics 2 and Content/Architecture
Slides from Class
View Slides From Class
Sept
29

Class 5: Information Architecture, Sketching and Mobile-First Design

We'll discuss information architecture and begin sketching. We'll discuss why designing mobile-first is important. Special Guest Speaker via Skype 6 p.m. - Karen McGrane, Managing Partner, Bond Art + Science

Read For Class
  • Sketching - the Visual Thinking Power Tool by Mike Rohde
  • Mobile First - Ch. 1 Growth, Ch. 2 Constraints, Ch. 3 Capabilities
Due Today
HTML Basics 2 and Content/Architecture

Project Sketches

Part 3: Visual Design and Development (CSS)

Oct
06

Class 6: Design Patterns, Style Tiles and CSS

In class we'll discuss how to develop a website's personality through design patterns and style tiles. In class, we'll use TypeCast, a tool to help choose typographic styles for the web. We'll also learn to use Sketch, a vector-based design tool. Finally, we'll begin discussing CSS.

Read For Class
  • HTML&CSS - Ch. 10 Introducing CSS
  • Style Tiles and How They Work by Samantha Warren
  • Our New Responsive Design Deliverable - The Style Prototype
  • Responsive Comping - Obtaining Client Feedback Without Mockups by Matt Griffin
  • Using Sketch for Responsive Web Design
  • The Post-PSD Era by Dan Mall
Due Today
Project Sketches
Assigned Today
CSS Basics
Slides from Class
View Slides From Class
Oct
13

Class 7: Web Typography, Colors and CSS Part 2

We'll continue our discussion on web typography, colors and styles. We'll also do a hands-on CSS exercise in class using CodePen. Special Guest Speakers Shawn Beatty and Jon Woodruff from the Nesnadny + Schwartz agency. In class, I'll have you take the mid-semester survey.

Read For Class
  • HTML&CSS - Ch. 11 Color, Ch. 12 Text, Ch. 14 Lists Tables & Forms
  • Mobile First - Ch.4 Organization, Ch. 5 Actions, Ch. 6 Inputs (if you didn't read this last week)
  • How We Read by Jason Santa Maria
  • Size Matters - Balancing Line Length and Font Size in Responsive Web Design
Due Today
CSS Basics
Assigned Today
Style Tiles
Slides from Class
View Slides From Class
Oct
20

Class 8: Style Tiles Critiques, CSS Box Model and CSS Part 3

We'll talk about developing style prototypes and continue our CSS lesson on the CSS box-model. Finally, we'll have an in-class critique/discussion about your style tiles.

Read For Class
  • HTML&CSS Ch. 13 Boxes, Ch. 15 Layout, Ch. 16 Images
  • Mobile First Ch. 7 Layout
  • In Class - Watch Understanding the CSS Box Model on Lynda.com
Due Today
Style Tiles
Assigned Today
CSS Basics 2
Slides from Class
View Slides From Class
Oct
27

Class 9: Atomic Design and HTML/CSS Layout

We'll put it all together and talk about developing layout systems in HTML/CSS. We'll talk about recent advancements in CSS relating to layout and how the atomic design methodology helps create more consistent web design systems. We'll practice with a hands-on assignment using media queries.

Read For Class
  • HTML&CSS - Ch. 17 HTML5 Layout
  • Responsive Web Design Ch. 2 The Flexible Grid, Ch. 3 Flexible Images, Ch. 4 Media Queries
  • Atomic Web Design by Brad Frost
  • Responsive Deliverables by Dave Rupert
  • Review - Responsive Design Patterns
  • Review - Pure CSS Navigation Pattern
Due Today
CSS Basics 2
Assigned Today
Layout/Media Queries
Slides from Class
View Slides From Class

Part 4: Prototyping, Testing and Style Guides

Nov
03

Class 10: Responsive Images, SVG and HTML Wireframing

We talk about the advanced use of images in HTML, including responsive images and SVG. We'll lightly touch on CSS animations. We'll also talk about wireframing templates with HTML and work on your next project assignment in class.

Read For Class
  • Using SVG by Chris Coyier
  • Responsive Images Done Right by Eric Portis
  • Mo' Pixels Mo' Problems
  • HTML Wireframes by Brad Frost
Due Today
Nothing due, continue working on Layout/Media Queries
Assigned Today
HTML Content Wireframes
Slides from Class
View Slides From Class
Nov
10

Class 11: Performance and Advanced Web Tools

We'll talk about adding interaction to your website using Jquery and JavaScript. We'll also talk about templating using GitHub Pages and Jekyll. Finally, we'll touch on how CSS preprocessors can speed up your development time.

Read For Class
  • Responsive Web Design - Ch. 5 Becoming Responsive
  • Fast Enough by Tim Kadlec
  • How we make RWD Sites load fast as heck by Scott Jehl
  • Understanding Progressive Enhancement by Aaron Gustafson
Due Today
Layout/Media Queries and HTML Content Wireframes
Assigned Today
Performance & Usability Testing and HTML/CSS Templates
Slides from Class
View Slides From Class
Nov
17

Class 12: Device Testing, Usability Testing and Iteration

We'll discuss how to ensure your website works well on multiple devices and browsers using the IdeaBase testing lab in class. We'll also talk about accessibility and why it's important. Finally, we'll also discuss how to develop usability and accessibility testing tasks and how to iterate on your design.

Read For Class
  • Usability testing - how do we design effective tasks by Tingting Zhao
  • Reframing Accessibility for the Web by Anne Gibson
  • Test on Real Mobile Devices Without Breaking the Bank by Brad Frost
  • How To Make a Performance Budget by Dan Mall
  • For Reference - The Hamburger Menu Doesn't Work
  • For Reference - Web Accessibility Checklist
Due Today
Nothing due today
Assigned Today
Nothing new assigned. Continue working on testing and HTML templates
Slides from Class
View Slides From Class
Nov
24

Class 13: Usability Testing In Class + Pattern Library

We conduct our usability tests in class and discuss how we can document our designs using style guides. We'll also discuss how your designs and content might be integrated into an enterprise-level content management system.

Read For Class
  • Getting Started with Pattern Libraries by Anna Debenham
  • Style Guide Best Practices by Brad Frost
  • Help Your Content Go Anywhere With A Mobile Content Strategy by Kerry Crawford
Due Today
Performance & Usability Testing Plan
Assigned Today
Pattern Library
Slides from Class
View Slides From Class
Dec
01

Class 14: Finalizing Prototypes and Style Guides

We'll finalize our content templates and pattern libraries based on testing feedback. If time, we'll briefly discuss print stylesheets, reset stylesheets and responsive email. Special Guest Speaker Ethan Marcotte, Responsive Web Design, Author via Skype (6 p.m.)

Read For Class
  • How Much Does a Responsive Web Design Cost? by Brad Frost
  • 9 Responsive Design Mistakes You Don't Want to Make
  • For Reference - How to Set Up A Print Style Sheet by Christian Krammer
Due Today
Nothing due today

Final Exam - Tuesday, Dec 15 - 5:30 - 8:00 p.m.

Dec
15

Final Exam: Class Review Session

You will not have a formal final exam. Your final prototype and pattern library will act as your final. We'll do our presentations and critiques during the final exam period. Groups will complete mock client feedback sessions with the class, and the class will evaluate the sessions based on the project goals and usability testing results.

Read For Class
Nothing to read
Due Today
HTML/CSS Templates, Pattern Library, Project Timeline, Presentation & Critiques and Self & Group Assessment (by end of finals week)
Assigned Today
Nothing assigned today
